title: (x) Fonts used in weekend Life Magazine - Knockout, Farnham, Benton Sans, Foundry Wilson {Mark S}
content:
What fonts are used in the weekend version of Life Magazine?  
Hint: There are four.
author: dhannah1000

comments.content: We get this with our Sunday paper. Looks like most of the heads are set in various weights of [Knockout](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414124256/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/knockout/series_c.html). The text is mostly [Farnham](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414124256/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Farnham) and (I think) News Gothic. Could be Trade Gothic, or even [Benton Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414124256/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/BentonSans). In fact, the latter seems more likely given the other fonts they use. I'm not sure if this is always true, but the latest issue features [Mrs. Eaves](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414124256/http:/emigre.com/EF.php?fid=109) for display type on the cover and the features. Oh, and I see a bit of [Gotham](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414124256/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/gotham/index.html) thrown in here and there.
That's Mrs. Eaves and something else in your scan.
BTW, what's the size of that image? 100 by 400 inches? :)

Read - the - friggin' - [guidelines for posting images on Typophile](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414124256/http:/typophile.com/node/18067)!

(...)

Sorry, lost control there. Not enough sleep, plus why do I put in all the effort if people don't care?
Oh, man. You're right. My mistake. Okay, so, something that resembles Mrs. Eaves.

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414124256im_/http:/typophile.com/files/lifems.jpg)

Here is the face in question. (I don't know why I thought it was Mrs. Eaves.)

"...why do I put in all the effort if people don’t care?"

People do care Yves. You are the Man! Some people overlook stuff like guidelines though. We will try harder next time :-)

We all know the BIG Deadline Blues and how life squeezes you. Sounds like you need a break and to go squeeze some babies :-)

ChrisL

Kind of late, but it appears to be [Foundry Wilson](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414124256/http:/www.foundrytypes.co.uk/). (Because of the way the site is set up, you need to navigate a bit to get to the specimen: Start by clicking on "Foundry Typefaces.")
